website_summaries.verdict: With the high bandwidth and fast download speeds demanded by modern gaming consoles, this model is a great option for users wanting a dedicated router for gaming.
pros: 1900 Mbps of bandwidth provides a reliable connection for long gaming sessions
This router offers the ability to simultaneously handle wired and wireless connections
Possible to use a console and WiFi-connected accessories together
When used as a dedicated gaming router, the dual band network handles intensive graphic displays without lag
cons: When used in combination with other devices, gamers may experience some lag during gameplay

customer_reviews.title: Seriously large range
customer_reviews.text: Got this based on the other reviewers' claims that it gave good range and they were right...it provides excellent coverage throughout our two-story 2900 sq ft house, the garage, and well out onto the property. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: N. Vollrath

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, easy to manage.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to manage. Very happy with this purchase. My internet speed had been getting held back by my old router. Now I'm getting nearly double the speed on my PC - very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Whitty

customer_reviews.title: Seller is trotting out OLD STOCK, look elsewere  the device DIED within one year.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Archer C1900 to get better range along with modernizing specs in general. This seller is selling an old model but doesn't say so I'd purchase elsewhere. As for performance; from my old D-link it did what I wanted by adding my two problem bedrooms to fully good signals. UPDATE: And it gets worse; the wired router portion has failed, so even though I have wireless connectivity, the connection to the modem/gateway is no more. I've gone with the Google solution and I suggest you RUN don't walk away from this device
customer_reviews.author: Bud O.

customer_reviews.title: Better range than a cheap router. Worse range than an Asus. Great for VPN
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router for 2 things. First It had an MTU setting that a lot of routers don't. Why is this so important? If you use a VPN with l2tp or pptp and experience a lot of disconnects and failed downloads you can reduce this to greatly improve connection. My Asus does not have this feature. On the other hand the 2.4GHz range is less than my asus (6-10 db less) and the 5GHz is slightly more. Maybe the Asus has better beamforming or something. I also had the same weak signals with the 800mW Amped wireless. I am keeping this though since the VPN performance is excellent. However it does not support openvpn so bear that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: mr s w cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect (is there a perfect router?), but the best we've come across so far.
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's performed fairly well. We have a 3000 sq ft. 2-story house, and we've gone through many routers over the years, and even though they've been placed in the center of the house, have had troubles of one sort or another (range, connectivity, etc.) -- range has never been what has been advertised. However, with this TP-Link, range is definitely better. It's not perfect - every once in a while we have a connectivity issue- but definitely having issues *much less* frequently. Our experience is that it's definitely the best router we've come across. Pretty happy with it, and I think there's a good chance others would be happy with it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Dug

customer_reviews.title: Can't Beat It!
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy with this product - so much better than many of the "big brand" wireless routers that I have owned in the past. Both 2G and 5G coverage is phenomenal and provides much faster linking than my old netgear in a big house. Been a workhorse that hasn't even needed rebooting once since I bought it and while the settings are extensive, the GUI presents a simplified set for beginners or non-network administrators to get it up and running while the really complex settings are hidden away unless you go searching for them. Foolproof and beginner proof - glad to see that there is still a tech company that isn't trying to dumb everything down and "nanny-state" us all.
customer_reviews.author: ATLBrysco

customer_reviews.title: Speed, range, and reliability
customer_reviews.text: Only had this for a week but it has boosted my file transfer speeds and streaming video tremendously. I finally got rid of the comcast provided modem/router that was costing me $10/month forever. This router has speed, range, reliability, and FREE lifetime support (which I hope to never need). I was even able to get rid of my range extenders because of the power of this router. My measured download speed on speedtest.net is now 90Mbs over wired and wireless connections.
customer_reviews.author: H. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Great range but an old hardware version.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately as another reviewer noted, mine was a hardware version 1 and I couldn’t find an updated driver on the website. Cloud features aren’t available etc. Otherwise this router had seriously good range - even better than the newer TP link I ultimately got - really wanted to keep it but since I couldn’t find an updated driver I was unsure if I might have issues down the line
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Router for streaming
customer_reviews.text: I've always brought TP-LINK and upgraded as products got bigger and better, Got a AC 2600 from big box store (big sale) had nothing but troubles(reboot,reboot,reboot) finally got this AC1900 because customers recommended it highly,and it is smooth as silk,get one of these you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Weiss

customer_reviews.title: My second one in 4 years
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the performance of this WiFi unit. The signal extends some 90 feet through walls and into my non-attached garage. Never had a problem with either 2.4 or 5G side of this TP-Link. I've used it for Amazon and Netflix streaming without any problems. Recommended. -v-
customer_reviews.author: Vince52

customer_reviews.title: The range I get is just plain super as I was also looking at the expensive wifi ...
customer_reviews.text: Kinda bummed that it shows version 1.0 by the serial number and not v2.0 but I can't complain because it's light years beyond my cable providers craptastic Arris wifi/modem which is now just enabled as a modem with wifi turned off. The range I get is just plain super as I was also looking at the expensive wifi mesh node option for my 3254 SQ. FT home especially with my Blink cameras located outside. This black router is essentially a C9 but advertised with higher output. It's a keeper and long gone are the constant drop outs and poor consistency, range and speed of my ISP's supplied box.
customer_reviews.author: cinz

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Steady Signal
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a month. Easy to set up on all 10 of my wifi devices. I haven't needed to turn it on and off to get it to keep working. I used the same SSID and password for both bands and my devices are doing a great job of using both evenly without too much or too little switching. In a 2,600 foot house, I have complete coverage; my router is in the upstairs corner of the house, in the opposite downstairs corner I get 40 of the 60 mbs that I pay for.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Blomberg

customer_reviews.title: Take the Instructions with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.text: I lack the technical knowledge to rate the WI-fi performance relative to other routers. It clearly seems to throw a better WI-fi cloud in my house than the router I replaced, a Netgear N750.  Installation was a real challenge because my modem needed to be rebooted AFTER the router is mounted and powered. The instructions that came with the TP-Link router instruct the opposite: to boot the router after it is attached to a running modem. All's well that ends well, I guess, but this product came real close to getting returned when I couldn't get it to work after following the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: dve

customer_reviews.title: WiFI is Intermittent - Unit is NG
customer_reviews.text: When it works it's great, problem is the WiFi keeps quitting. Worked fine for about 30 Hours. Then WiFi cuts out in a random fashion. A reboot will restore it, but only for about an hour. Then it's completely useless. I checked the antenna connections (all good) and it's in a cool environment so it can't be overheating. Had to go back to my old Lynksys, the TP-Link is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast!  Holy Range Batman!
customer_reviews.text: I had a lesser router before with range extenders in my shop and even another part of my house. Once I got this one setup all those extenders went back on the shelf. I get 2.4ghz in my shop now which is 80' from my house and steel. Works great. I leave in the morning for work and I'm down the road before I lose signal. I have a long driveway too. Got a hell of a deal around Christmas and not a regret in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Good router but cant flash with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: Was unable to flash the black TP-Link C1900 High Power with DD-WRT. But it is a good router so not worth taking off a star for that. But I got the white Archer C9 so I could flash it with DD-WRT. Here is the link for the one I ordered and flashed with DD-WRT, which is rockkkk solid and great coverage for 3,700 sq ft house on all 3 stories, including out to mailbox!
customer_reviews.author: Chapelhillkid

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Fort Knox
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Great range and speeds for all devices at decent range. Switch to the 2.4ghz for longer range, be aware it's a more congested channel. I have it set in the middle of my 2 story home and I can get a clear connection with my phone even 100ft away from the house.
customer_reviews.author: NDspd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: greatest wireless router. cannot get better. great range, look, dual band and doesn't fail
customer_reviews.author: bjackfly

customer_reviews.title: Solid so far
customer_reviews.text: Been working well so far. No hard reset yet. After waiting years for Apple to come out with a new AP I had to look elsewhere when they disbanded their Wifi development unit. My speedtest scores went up after replacing the old Airport Extreme AB/G unit. I like the looks of this model vs the ones with too many antenna. Stand up design helps save space.
customer_reviews.author: Zergie808

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 9 year old TP-Link router. The setup was easy and quick. Greater coverage and a smaller unit. Works great and will probably buy TP-Link again in 9 years!
customer_reviews.author: PJ Lawson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! Awesome range
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Awesome range. Easy setup. Really like the android app. I printed out the setup manual in anticipation of a difficult install, but after I got done answering a few setup questions, I realized I was all done and hadn't even touched my print out. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: cacauba

customer_reviews.title: Looks like there is a disconnect between the order and what ...
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered two TP- Link AC 1900 Version 2 but got Version 1 twice, and am tired of sending it back. Looks like there is a disconnect between the order and what the customer receives.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Well it certainly is an upgrade from my Linksys router I can now stream on pretty much all devices at the same time without them freezing or buffering
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation. Solved Internet Issues
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Replaced an old router with this model and our internet problems have disappeared. We started having issues when we added smart home items and it was obviously too much for our router to handle. Installation was easy and we are extremely satisfied thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as an access point for my existing network. It took less than 15 minutes to remove from packaging, setup, and connect my first device. Fast and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Works excellently!
customer_reviews.text: I'm more than happy to have finally joined the AC crowd. My 6Mbps downloads have become my ISP's max of 100Mbps. Has a great range. Doesn't get hot to the touch. I get a full signal through concrete walls. More than pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Trust TP-Link
customer_reviews.text: I did not use this router because I returned it. I have other TP-Link products which are quality and work extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Great gear
customer_reviews.text: My modem and router combo was pretty outdated and I was getting ~10Mbs over WiFi. I upgraded to this router and I see >50Mbs with the exact same service all over the house including out on the porch! No interruptions, works with my ISP, (fairly) easy set-up.
customer_reviews.author: G. Reece

customer_reviews.title: Definitely like this router and highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely like this router and highly recommend it. Big difference in strength and strength at distance compared to the Netgear it replaces. Much faster! The only negative is that it has to stand upright. I have limited room and this would be more convenient if it could be layed down.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router & definitely worth the purchase. The wi-fi speed & extended range is as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Culver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to say I'm not one to write reviews, but when a product is great people should know. It was very easy to hook up and install, directions that were include was very simple. After hooking this up my speeds exceed what my comcast modem provides and range is far more better. Excellent all around and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Defective, bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this product. We had this product for less than 6 weeks before it completely stopped working for no reason. The company's customer support was useless, and the manufacturer states that this is not a company that is on their approved list. So after only 6 weeks, neither would help us, and it was a complete waste of money and lots of time.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L

customer_reviews.title: Had routers since 90s. Best thus far!
customer_reviews.text: Install took 5-10min. Super easy! Have coverage in 2500 sq ft home (multi level).
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: This router gives great range throughout my house
customer_reviews.text: This router gives great range throughout my house. My office is on one side of my house and my master bedroom is on the other side and I have no issues with internet connection in the master (grant it my house is only 1200 square feet). WiFi speed is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: "Unauthorized Reseller" - Warranty Void
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of ownership, the WAN port on this router died. Because I bought it from a seller that isn't on TP Link's list of authorized resellers, the warranty was voided and I was unable to RMA. Now I will have to pay for a replacement out of pocket, a full day's work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Models are unreliable
customer_reviews.text: You shouldn't have to be manually rebooting a router that costs $150. If it happens, you wait for a firmware. When that firmware doesn't come for 2 years, you are justifiably bummed out.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Lost signal every other hour or so
customer_reviews.text: Worked for an hour before losing the its connection. Had to keep rebooting it, but eventually would drop out. Not sure if there was a compatibility issue or was simply defective. returned it. Will try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal and great coverage.
customer_reviews.text: The router deserves 5 stars, but the tech support is not as described. Difficult to get through on the phone and dialect is not easily understood. I did figure it out on my own after getting the correct link after some searching. Signal strength is great. Even outside away from the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far this product is wonderful. My son can game
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble with my old router kicking off and would have to reset it. So far this product is wonderful. My son can game, I can use the computer and we always have 4 phones connected. What a nice change to be able to use all products in my house. My house is 3 levels 2400 sq. and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Used or new?
customer_reviews.text: Received on expected date but when I opened it I couldn’t tell if it was new or refurbished or used because the router was dirty, not all parts were packaged, and the default password wasn’t the same as what the instructions said so I had to reset the router to the default settings which I thought was odd
customer_reviews.author: autococker1976

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! It only worked for about 2 weeks. I've been gone all fire season, and missed the return window of course.
customer_reviews.author: Cole D.

customer_reviews.title: A great Wi-Fi router.
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless router. I have had no problems with it since I bought it three months ago. And I have great range. I even have an Linksys extender in an outside shed that increases the Wi-Fi strength in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit but no improvement with current hardware
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit to increase my wifi coverage. Have an Apple Airport Time Capsule as my main router. Found that cannot achieve maximum speed because you need devices with same technology (Wireless AC). Had some weird performance on 5G, 2.4 is Ok
customer_reviews.author: Mario Capovilla

customer_reviews.title: This thing works better than any I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This thing works better than any I have owned. I was having to re-boot my high dollar A**is router every other day. This one has been up and running for a few months and has not required a re-boot yet. Good Product
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: Drops connections regularly
customer_reviews.text: This router is constantly dropping connections. Only recovery is to reboot. No firmware updates are available to fix problems.
customer_reviews.author: Russ E

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Signal strength is very good. I get reception further than stated and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Branden in Barker

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and noticed instant increase in range and ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and noticed instant increase in range and speed compared to an outdated router. The 5ghz network is more consistent than other routers I've used in the past as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W. Dengler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The signal from this thing is definitely stronger when compared to it's AC1750 counterpart.
customer_reviews.author: EvanJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup with good instructions
customer_reviews.text: As easy to set up as others have mentioned. Probably a better router than I need but it works fine and is the first one I have owned. No more money to the cable company and their rented equipment.
customer_reviews.author: fretlessjimfla

customer_reviews.title: Great range very satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.text: Great range very satisfied with this product. But for my house I also bought the rage extender and together the r awesome
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: User Error
customer_reviews.text: At first I could not figure out how to connect to wifi and I have two wifi routers. Let's just say user error. Once I figured out what I was doing wrong it was 1, 2, 3 and DONE! The cameras work great and the app is so easy to use my Mom can use it! Customer service is exceptional!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great FAST product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Tripled my speed when used with modem supplied by Spectrum! Works great
customer_reviews.author: AJ THE KJ boy

customer_reviews.title: then i would recommend this unit
customer_reviews.text: does not work with windows 10 and network mapped drive. if you don't use network mapped drive, then i would recommend this unit. easy setup and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Fontenot

customer_reviews.title: has all the great geeky feature my techo-hubby likes to tinker with and ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple setup, has all the great geeky feature my techo-hubby likes to tinker with and range is outstanding. no drop outs, outstanding range and excellent through put.
customer_reviews.author: VTCindi

customer_reviews.title: Upload speed was never good. Reboots used to fix it but not anymore
customer_reviews.text: Download throughput dropped off after a few weeks of operation. Upload speed was never good. Reboots used to fix it but not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Way better modem/router than the modem we were renting from our cable provider. Great wifi signal through the whole house. Easy set up. We're happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 2cannon

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional range
customer_reviews.text: The range is exceptional. I thought I'd need an additional access point, but it covers a really huge area.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, how to guide is available, worth the money checked prices at Regular stores and it was higher then Amazon, tried it, and completely satisfied with this product,
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: can't figure out how to activate the port forwarding, I have a video server hooked to the router,, but I need to have the port forwarded so I can see the server on my phone or computer
customer_reviews.author: Michael Trofimchuck

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Looked like it was returned when we received it, couple scratches and nothing was in the original packing, but we put used it and had had no issues. Great for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in every way
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in every way. Very strong signal. No reboots in a month so far. Very pleased. Get this one instead of the Archer C9. They are the same but this one has a stronger transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: MARTIN E FRIEDMAN

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to set up. Up and running in minutes. Stable. Haven't had to reboot it since I set it up over 2 months ago. Fast. Video streams in HD over wireless consistently without hiccups. Strong signal bathes my 2800 sq ft house. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Scott N

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great router and price! I got a better connection than other brands and longer reception
customer_reviews.author: Mark Musich

customer_reviews.title: Check your hardware version (on back on label) first. You may find you have an older version,
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon description listed hardware 2.0. The one I received was version 1.0
customer_reviews.author: Virtualmonk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this router. easy to assemble and so far it has been faithful.
customer_reviews.author: NoSalary

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a cheap Belkin. It is not faster, does not reach as far and seems to drop at times. Save money and just buy a cheap Belkin at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: L. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Works great, speeds are great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, speeds are great, but signal strength wasn't as I expected for being the high power model. I have had this for a few months now and not a single problem. Speeds are above and beyond! I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: R. Perrone

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. Excellent quality and performance.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Another great product by tp-link
customer_reviews.text: Another great product by tp-link. Very easy to set up. Very good coverage and it looks sexy. The wirecutter recommended this and I can see why. my 5 GHZ speeds are insane. The UI (user interface) is very simple and easy to figure out. There is also a great App for TP-Link called "tether". Great options for parental control without needed a degree in IT. Almost plug and play. The speeds I am getting are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Halbert

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and great coverage, have this at one end of the house (ranch home) and still just as fast at the other end, coverage outside pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This WiFi router was easy to setup and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi router was easy to setup and works like a charm. I have not experienced any problems with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product description says V2 but I received V1! I can't return since I shipped it overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome, great range. does what it's suppose to do, great wireless speeds
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Home Router I Have Used
customer_reviews.text: Excellent distance for strong signal. No reboots necessary after 2 years. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to setup. So far it has been working great and was a definite improvement over my old router.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dean

customer_reviews.title: The power on this router is excellent, it reaches the whole entire house
customer_reviews.text: The power on this router is excellent, it reaches the whole entire house, and we live in a 2200 square foot home.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Riccio

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an 8 year old router with this. It is easy to setup and create passwords. I loose connectivity with it every once in a while since I received it.. Not as reliable as my older router that only had to be reset 2 or 3 times a year. It has dual bands which is good since our nursery camera is on the older frequency. I must say that the speed has increased noticeably when streaming videos or on the internet. It covers pretty much the same distance as our old router.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother.
customer_reviews.text: This router was somewhat easy to set up, however the 5G makes the 2.4G signal almost impossible to connect to. When the 5G is off, the connection is possible with our devices but the connection is CONSTANTLY disconnecting. I am very upset with the product especially since I assumed we were buying a very good router. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is excellent and worth to buy. It is above my expectation in deed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad luck!
customer_reviews.text: Unit was DOA. I was able to return without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: CarlosA

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: On second one and it doesn't work either. Tech support is in China. Horrible support.
customer_reviews.author: Honey Badger

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: its not what i expected. But its okay for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar C.

customer_reviews.title: Was not good for us
customer_reviews.text: Was not good for us, it dropped wireless connection like crazy, that is and was the purpose of getting this suppose to be quick and fast wireless router but boy were we wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Marie/Peanut

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good performance and through put. dd-wrt can be installed without problems.
customer_reviews.author: hallo

customer_reviews.title: Version V1
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, this is the OLD version V1 from 2015. Not that there is anything wrong with it, really, but the seller doesn't advertise this as the old model, so I will just clear this up for you.
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: TP-Link generally makes high quality devices, and this is no exception. I am very impressed with the performance, the user interface, and quality. This is a high end router, and I am impressed. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Can't maintain a connection ....
customer_reviews.text: Right now I'm not very happy. The first day everything worked fine. Wired and wireless users connected without any issues. Days 2-4 the router would drop the wired connection every couple of minutes. The wireless connection would drop at least once per day. I will attempt to resolve the issue before returning.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cram

customer_reviews.title: Negative Ghost Rider
customer_reviews.text: Defective. My ISP never even heard of this brand. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Mertzig

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you want it to email you it's logs
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this if you expect to have a router that will actually email it's logs to you. Most ISPs do not accept SMTP connections on port 25 to which this defaults. If your ISP does allow this security flaw, then emailing will work. You can even use password authentication. But if your ISP requires a port other than 25 before it will accept mail from the router, you are out of luck. There is NO WAY to specify a port other than 25! None. Zip. Nada. Can you believe that? How completely lame and very stupid in this day and age!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Whitebeard

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I won't be buying TP-Link products anymore. I'm currently looking for another brand to switch to.
customer_reviews.author: TeaPartyHost

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 5GHz range!
customer_reviews.text: So far it works great! I placed this router in our upstairs bedroom which is basically furthest away from everything else in the house. The living room is on the other side of the house, downstairs, and my Nexus 6P shows half WiFi strength on the 5GHz connection. Haven't tried attaching USB storage or a printer yet, but if you need good 2.4 and 5 GHz range and speed, this is the router for you!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great speed, reliability and signal strength
customer_reviews.text: This a very powerful router. Great speed, reliability and signal strength. The only partial drawback is the web UI. I also tried to update it to DD-WRT but apparently the V2 firmware will not work with this one yet. Besides that, the current UI is manageable for now.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin S

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC1900 High Power Wireless Wi-Fi Gigabit Router, Ideal for Gaming (Archer C1900)
product_meta.description:
The Archer C1900 creates a reliable, blazing-fast network using 802.11ac, dual band, and high-powered 900mW amplifiers for ultimate Wi-Fi coverage. Stream 4K Ultra HD video and game online without lag over a clear 5GHz band while using the 2.4GHz band for everyday tasks like checking email and web browsing. The C1900's dual USB ports make it easy to share files, photos, and music across your network, and beamforming technology helps the router strengthen its connections to WiFi devices.


Key Features: 
Dual Band 2.4GHz (up to 600Mbps) + 5GHz (up to 1300Mbps) 
1GHz Dual Core Processor
3x High Powered Dual Band External Antennas
900mW Amplifiers
4x 10/100/1000Mbps Ethernet Ports + 1x Gigabit WAN Port
1x USB 3.0 + 1x USB 2.0 Ports
Beamforming
Package Contents: 
AC1900 High Power Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router Archer C1900
3 detachable antennas
Power supply unit
Resource CD
Ethernet Cable
Quick Installation Guide
Support: 
Industry-leading 2-year warranty and 24/7 premium technical support. Frequency Range: 2.4GHz and 5GHz; Interface Available: 4 x 10/100/1000Mbps LAN Ports , 1 10/100/1000Mbps WAN Port, 1 USB 3.0 Port + 1 USB 2.0 Port; Protocols Supported: Supports IPv4 and IPv6; System Requirement: Microsoft Windows 98SE NT 2000 XP Vista, or Windows 7 Windows 8/8.1/10, MAC OS NetWare UNIX or Linux; Wireless Standards: IEEE 802.11ac/n/a 5GHz, IEEE 802.11b/g/n 2.4GHz
feature_bullets: Game online and stream 4D hk video with 1900Mbps of total available bandwidth
Simultaneous WiFi dual band networks with 2.4GHz (600Mbps) and 5GHz (1300Mbps)
Supercharge your WiFi coverage thanks to three dual band antennas with 900mW high powered amplifiers
1GHz dual core Processor handles simultaneous wired and wireless connections without interruption
Lightning fast wired connections using four Gigabit Ethernet ports

specifications.Operating System: Microsoft Windows 98SE, NT, 2000, XP, Vista or Windows 7, Windows 8/8.1/10. MAC OS, NetWare, UNIX or Linux
